entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 0 ft., one Medium or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by the giant electric catfish. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) acid damage and the target is swallowed (see above).

action.name: Electricity Discharge {@recharge}
entries: A giant electric catfish can generate a pulse of electricity. Every creature within 10 feet of the giant catfish takes {@dice 2d6} points of lightning damage and is {@condition stunned} until the start of the giant catfish's next turn. A successful {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw reduces damage to half and negates the stun.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Fluid Drain
entries: {@atk m} automatic hit, one creature already {@condition grappled} by the giant horsefly at the start of the horsefly's turn. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage and the target must make a successful {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition paralyzed} until it is no longer {@condition grappled} by the giant horsefly.

trait.name: Water Dependency
entries: Giant moray eels can survive out of water for 15 minutes. After that, they begin suffocating.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled}. The grapple is broken if the eel tries to bite a different target.

action.name: Gnaw
entries: {@atk m} automatic hit, one creature already {@condition grappled} at the start of the eel's turn. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must make a successful {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage and lose 1 point of Charisma.

trait.name: Symbiotic Vermin
entries: Any living creature other than another giant beetle that ends its turn adjacent to a giant rhinoceros beetle must make a successful {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that was not adjacent to the beetle at the start of the beetle's turn. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail Slap
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Vorpal Bite
entries: The mandibles of a slicer beetle are extremely sharp. It scores a critical hit if the attack roll is a natural 19 or 20. If a slicer beetle scores a critical hit on its attack roll, the affected creature must make a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw. Failure indicates the slicer beetle severed one of the opponent's extremities (roll {@dice 1d8}: 1–4 = arm, 5–8 = leg; even = right, odd = left).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage. If this attack scores a critical hit, see Vorpal Bite.

trait.name: Smothering
entries: When a giant slug of P'nahk hits a creature with its crushing attack, it drops its body onto the creature, pinning it to the ground. Treat this as being {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained}, but the creature must also make an immediate {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. A successful saving throw indicates the creature inhaled a lungful of air before being trapped; a failed saving throw indicates the air was forced from the creature's lungs and it is suffocating. A suffocating creature can act normally for a number of rounds equal to its Con modifier (minimum of 1 round). Once those rounds expire, the creature drops to 0 hit points at the start of its next turn and it must make death saving throws.

trait.name: Insanity of P'nahk
entries: A giant P'Nahki slug can produce a momentary mental blast that transmits subliminal images of the nightmarish realm of P'nahk. All creatures in the affected area that fail a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw recall these images and must roll {@dice 1d4} to determine how they are affected (see below). In addition, affected characters repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns; the effect ends with a successful save (indicating the character managed to forget the images). Characters with Int scores of 16 or higher are peculiarly vulnerable to this attack; they make the saving throws with tactical disadvantage.

rows: {@condition Paralyzed}; the character strikes back instinctively with a melee attack or a cantrip (as a reaction) against anything that attacks him or her, but can take no other action and can't move.
Paranoid rage; the character attacks its nearest allies.
Self loathing; the character drops any held items and claws at his or her body, inflicting {@dice 1d4} slashing damage per round.
Awe of P'nahk; the character drops all held items, falls {@condition prone}, and grovels in worship of the slug and all things P'nahki. The character is {@condition paralyzed}.

trait.name: Telepathy
entries: Giant slugs of P'nahk are telepathic, so they can communicate with all creatures within 100 feet.

trait.name: Transparency
entries: Because of its transparent body, a giant slug of P'nahk always has tactical advantage on Stealth checks and it can attempt to hide anytime it is lightly obscured, such as when it is in dim light.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A giant slug of P'nahk bites once and crushes once, or uses its mind blast.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Crush
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and the target is knocked {@condition prone}, {@condition grappled}, {@condition restrained}, and smothered (see above).

action.name: Mind Blast {@recharge}
entries: {@atk a} automatic hit, range 60 ft. cone, creatures in cone. {@h}every creature in the affected area must make a successful {@dc 14} Intelligence saving throw or be affected by the insanity of P'nahk (see above). Characters with Int 16 or higher have tactical disadvantage on the saving throw.

trait.name: Water Dependent
entries: Giant water beetles can survive out of water for eight hours. After that, they gain one level of {@condition exhaustion} every 10 minutes until they die or return to fresh water.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} för att träffa, räckvidd 1,5 meter, en varelse. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) stickande skada.

action.name: Ink Cloud {@recharge}
entries: As a bonus action while it is underwater, a giant water beetle can emit a cloud of jet-black ink that fills a sphere centered on itself with a radius of 10 feet. The area inside the ink cloud is heavily obscured.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: A gillmonkey can breathe equally well in air or underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A gillmonkey bites once and attacks once with claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

resist.note: and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: A glacial ooze can move through gaps as small as 1 square foot as if it's difficult terrain.

trait.name: Freezing Embrace
entries: As it moves, a glacial ooze can enter spaces occupied by Large or smaller creatures. If the creature whose space is being entered makes a successful {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, the creature can move safely out of the glacial ooze's path. If the saving throw fails, the creature is engulfed: it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage immediately, is {@condition restrained}, can't breathe, and takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) cold damage at the start of each of the glacial ooze's turns. An engulfed creature can use an action on its turn to try to escape from the glacial ooze; the creature escapes if it makes a successful {@dc 14} Strength check. A creature adjacent to the glacial ooze can use an action to try to pull one engulfed creature free. The rescue succeeds if the creature makes a successful {@dc 14} Strength check, and the creature making the check takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage whether it succeeds or fails. A glacial ooze can contain up to four creatures that are Medium or smaller, or one Large creature.

trait.name: Superchilled
entries: A glacial ooze's form is extremely cold. Creatures that hit a glacial ooze with natural weapons or with an unarmed attack take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage per hit.

trait.name: Transparent
entries: A glacial ooze is hard to spot, even under ideal conditions. A {@dc 15} Wisdom (Perception) check is needed to notice one, and if the ooze is drifting in water or is surrounded by blowing snow (as it usually is), this check is made with tactical disadvantage. Creatures who blunder into the glacial ooze's space are treated exactly as if the ooze had attacked them with its freezing embrace, but they make the Dex saving throw with tactical disadvantage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage.

trait.name: All-Around Vision
entries: A gloomcrawler's many eyes allow it to scan quickly in all directions. Attackers never gain tactical advantage or bonus damage against it from the presence of nearby allies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A gloom crawler attacks ten times with tentacles and bites once. Each tentacle can either slam or constrict.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature {@condition grappled} by the gloom crawler. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage and the creature is dragged to the gloom crawler's mouth.

action.name: Tentacle Slam
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Tentacle Constriction
entries: {@atk m} automatic hit, one creature already {@condition grappled} by the gloom crawler at the start of the gloom crawler's turn. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained}.

trait.name: Protected from Good
entries: Good-aligned creatures have tactical disadvantage when attacking a gnarlwood, and it can't be {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or possessed by a good-aligned creature.

trait.name: Rend
entries: If a single target is hit by two of the gnarlwood's clawed branch attacks in a single turn, that target automatically takes an additional 15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage and is {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Unhallowed Aura
entries: When an undead creature within 30 feet of a gnarlwood attacks or makes a saving throw, it can roll {@dice 1d4} along with its {@dice d20} and add the results together.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A gnarlwood attacks four times with clawed branches, or it uses a spell-like ability.

action.name: Clawed Branch
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The gnarlwood's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). The gnarlwood doesn't need material components to use these abilities.

trait.name: Escape Artist (1/Day)
entries: The golden cat teleports up to 30 feet as a move.

trait.name: Luck/Unluck (3/Day)
entries: The owner of a golden cat can reroll one die and take the most favorable result, provided the golden cat is within 40 feet of its owner. Only one reroll is allowed per round. This ability is a power of the cat, which responds to its owner's telepathic request for luck. There is a downside, however. Each time the golden cat grants luck (a reroll) to its owner, it saps a bit of luck from other, nearby creatures. All other creatures (including the owner's allies) within 40 feet of the golden cat have tactical disadvantage on their first attack roll or ability check for one round.

trait.name: Explosive
entries: When a gorbel takes piercing or slashing damage, it must make a successful Constitution saving throw or it explodes. The DC for the saving throw equals 5 plus the damage taken from the attack. When it explodes, all creatures within 5 feet of it take 4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) force damage, or half damage with a successful {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw. The gorbel dies instantly, of course.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A gorbel bites once and attacks once with claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) slashing damage. A target of Small size or smaller is pulled to within 5 feet of the gorbel; if the target is Medium size or larger, the gorbel pulls itself to within 5 feet of the target.

trait.name: Dragon Breath
entries: The breath weapon used by a gorgimera's dragon head depends on the color of its dragon head, as listed on the table below. Regardless of its type, a gorgimera's breath weapon deals 13 ({@dice 3d8}) points of damage, or half damage to targets that make a successful {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. To determine a gorgimera's head color and breath weapon randomly, roll {@dice 1d10} and consult the table.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A gorgimera bites once, and attacks once with its horns and twice with claws. The horn attack can be replaced by gorgon breath, and the bite attack can be replaced by dragon breath.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +7} för att träffa, räckvidd 1,5 meter, en varelse. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) snittskada.

action.name: Horns
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Dragon Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk a} automatic hit, range varies, creatures in area. {@h}13 ({@dice 3d8}) damage (type varies), or half damage with a successful {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw.

action.name: Gorgon Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk a} automatic hit, range 30 ft. cone, creatures in cone. {@h}targets must make a successful {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition restrained} as they begin turning to stone. A {@condition restrained} creature attempts the saving throw again at the end of its next turn. If the second saving throw succeeds, the effect ends. If the second saving throw fails, the target is permanently {@condition petrified}; a greater restoration spell can reverse the petrification.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A gorilla bear attacks twice with claws.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage. If both claw attacks hit the same target, the target is {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained}, and it takes an additional 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage. The grapple ends automatically at the start of the gorilla bear's next turn, if the creature hasn't escaped before then.

trait.name: Keen Scent
entries: A gray nisp can taste blood in the surrounding water from a distance of up to 1 mile.

trait.name: Water Dependent
entries: A gray nisp can survive out of water for only 10 minutes. After that, it begins suffocating.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A gray nisp bites once and attacks twice with claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage. If both claws hit the same target, it takes an additional 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: A gray nisp's inante spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, +4to hit with spell attacks). The gray nisp doesn't need material components to use these abilities.

trait.name: Foul Breath
entries: A greater basilisk's breath is extremely foul. Any creature adjacent to a greater basilisk's head (within 5 feet of its head, this applies automatically to anyone targeted by the basilisk's bite) must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. Failure indicates the creature is {@condition poisoned} (per the condition) until it moves more than 5 feet away from the basilisk's head and then makes a successful save at the end of its turn. A successful save means the creature is immune to this basilisk's breath for 24 hours.

trait.name: Gaze
entries: A living creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of a greater basilisk must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. Failure indicates the creature begins turning to stone; it immediately becomes {@condition restrained}, and it must make another {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of its next turn. Success on the second saving throw ends this effect. Failure on the second saving throw means the creature is {@condition petrified}. A creature that is capable of taking actions can look away to avoid the greater basilisk's gaze, but if it targets the basilisk while averting its gaze, the creature suffers all the usual penalties for attacking an unseen target. Creatures that are blind, {@condition unconscious}, or unable to see the greater basilisk for any other reason are immune to this attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The greater basilisk bites once and attacks once with claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus {@dice 3d6} poison damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus {@dice 2d6} poison damage.

trait.name: Aversion to Daylight
entries: Boneneedles shun light. While exposed to natural (not magical) sunlight, they have tactical disadvantage on all attack rolls, saving throws, and skill checks.

trait.name: Boneneedle Poison
entries: The bite of a boneneedle injects a syrupy neurotoxin that destroys flesh and weakens bone. A creature that fails its saving throw against boneneedle poison gains the {@condition poisoned} condition. While the creature is {@condition poisoned} by boneneedle poison, it also takes an extra 2 points of damage whenever it takes bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage. Cumulative bites do not increase the extra damage. The {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw after a long or short rest, ending the {@condition poisoned} condition with a successful save. A lesser restoration spell or comparable magic also neutralizes the poison.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage and the target must make a successful {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned}, suffering the effect of boneneedle poison (see above).

trait.name: Ring of Fire
entries: The body of a greater fire crab generates intense heat. Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of a greater fire crab takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage. This damage is cumulative if more than one fire crab is within 5 feet of the character.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A greater fire crab attacks twice, in any combination of pincer and crush attacks.

action.name: Pincer
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) fire damage and the target is {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Crush
entries: {@atk m} automatic hit, one creature already {@condition grappled} at the start of the fire crab's turn. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage and the target is {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Psychic Waves (1/Day)
entries: As an action, a green brain can emit a pulse of psychic energy to debilitate and disarm potential foes. The pulse affects all creatures with Int 3 or higher within 50 feet of the green brain.

" Every creature in the affected area must make a successful {@dc 13} Intelligence saving throw or be affected as if {@condition poisoned} until the start of the green brain's next turn. This is a psychic effect, not poison, so resistance to poison provides no defense against it.
" Every creature in the affected area must make a successful {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or drop everything it is holding in its hands.
Every spellcaster in the affected area must make a successful {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be unable to cast spells for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

action.name: Psychic Bolt
entries: {@atk r} automatic hit, range 50 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) psychic damage, or half damage if the target makes a successful {@dc 13} Intelligence saving throw.

trait.name: Breath Weapon
entries: A dracolisk can use its breath weapon as an attack. Its breath characteristics are determined by its draconic background, as summarized on the table. Regardless of the type of breath weapon involved, targets in the area of effect take half damage with a successful {@dc 16} Dex saving throw. Lines are 5 feet wide.

trait.name: Immunity to Energy
entries: Varje typ av dracolisk är immun mot den energityp som är inneboende i dess eget andningsvapen, vilket sammanfattas i tabellen.

trait.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries: Som en attack kan en dracolisk rikta sin petrifierande blick mot en levande varelse inom 30 fot och synfältet. Om den måltavlade varelsen kan se dracolisken måste den måltavlade varelsen göra ett lyckat {@dc 15} räddningskast för konstitutionen eller börja förvandlas till sten; den blir omedelbart {@condition restrained} och måste göra ett nytt {@dc 15} räddningskast för konstitutionen i slutet av sin nästa vändning. Ett lyckat andra räddningskast avslutar denna effekt. Misslyckande på det andra räddningskastet innebär att varelsen blir {@condition petrified} permanent. En varelse som är kapabel att vidta åtgärder kan i början av sin tur titta bort för att undvika dracoliskens blick i en hel runda. Om den riktar sig mot dracolisken medan den vänder blicken bort lider den av alla vanliga straff för att attackera ett osynligt mål. Varelser som är blinda, {@condition unconscious}, eller som inte kan se dracolisken av någon annan anledning är immuna mot denna attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: En dracolisk biter en gång och attackerar en gång med klor, eller så använder den sitt andningsvapen eller sin förstenande blick.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +8} för att träffa, räckvidd 1,5 meter, en varelse. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) genomträngande skada.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +8} för att träffa, räckvidd 1,5 meter, en varelse. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) snittskada.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk a} automatic hit, range 30 ft. cone, creatures in range. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid damage, or half damage with a successful {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. See Breath Weapon, above, for variables.

resist.note: damage from nonmagical weapons or not made of adamantine

trait.name: Reanimation
entries: A green guardian gargoyle that is destroyed will reanimate {@dice 1d8 + 2} days later unless its eyes are removed, crushed, and disenchanted by casting both dispel magic (automatic) and greater restoration on them. If the eyes are taken away but not destroyed, they simply disappear from wherever they are and reappear in the green guardian's eye sockets at the moment it reanimates. The same applies to any other body parts that were demolished or removed.

trait.name: Stony Appearance
entries: While a green guardian gargoyle sits motionless, it can't be detected as a living creature by any means.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A green guardian gargoyle attacks once with claws and gores once with its horns.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) slashing damage. If both claw attacks hit the same target, the target is also {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Grimm

resist.note: damage from nonsilver or nongood weapons

languages: Understands Common and Sylvan but can't speak

trait.name: Aura of Evil
entries: A grimm constantly exudes a miasma of evil around itself. Any creature that begins its turn within 5 feet of a grimm takes {@dice 2d6} radiant damage. Creatures of evil alignment are immune to this effect.

trait.name: Diehard
entries: A grimm does not die when it reaches 0 hit points. Instead, the creature continues fighting, but it must make a Constitution saving throw every time it takes damage while at 0 hit points. The DC of the saving throw equals the damage from the attack. The first time the grimm fails this saving throw, it gains tactical disadvantage on all its attack rolls and ability checks, but it keeps fighting. When it fails this saving throw for a second time, it dies instantly.

trait.name: Devour
entries: If both of a grimm's claw attacks and its bite attack hit the same target in a single turn, the grimm gains temporary hit points equal to the piercing damage done by its bite.

trait.name: Ethereal Jaunt {@recharge 5}
entries: A grimm can shift between the Ethereal Plane and the Material Plane as a bonus action when it moves. It can remain on the Ethereal Plane only until ethereal jaunt recharges; it must return to the Material Plane on the first turn it can (but not necessarily as the first thing it does that turn; the grimm could move in the Ethereal Plane before returning to the Material Plane). While in the Ethereal Plane, the grimm can't be seen or harmed by anyone on the Material Plane except by magical effects that cross the planar boundary. It can see and hear what is around it (within 60 feet) on the Material Plane, but it can't harm anything in the Material Plane. While Ethereal, the grimm can move in any direction, even up or down and through solid objects, but it treats all space as difficult terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A grimm attacks twice with its claws, then bites once.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage. If both claw attacks hit the same target, the grimm gains tactical advantage on its bite attack if it makes that attack immediately against the same target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) piercing damage. Also see devour, above.

action.name: Ethereal Jaunt {@recharge 5}
entries: See entry in traits.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: A grimm's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The grimm doesn't need material components to use these abilities.

3e: {@spell detect evil and good|phb|detect fey} (as detect evil and good but detects fey only)

trait.name: Grippli Shaman
entries: Any large group of gripplis (12 or more) will be accompanied by one or more tribal shamans.

trait.name: Grippli Poison
entries: A target hit by a {@condition poisoned} grippli dart must make a successful {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for {@dice 1d4} rounds. At the end of the last turn of poisoning, the target repeats the saving throw. A successful save means the target recovers, but a failed save means the target becomes {@condition paralyzed} for {@dice 1d6} rounds. A successful saving throw does not make the target immune to later poisonings.

trait.name: Swamp Stride
entries: Gripplis can move across mud, muck, shallow water, and any other difficult terrain that arises from the presence of water without penalty.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dart
entries: {@atk r} {@hit +5} to hit, range 20 ft./60 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage. If poison is used, see grippli poison, above.

action.name: Net
entries: {@atk r} {@hit +5} to hit, range 5 ft./15 ft., one creature. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained} until it makes a successful {@dc 10} Strength check or until 5 slashing damage is done to the net (AC 10). Targets of Huge size or larger are not affected.

trait.name: Grippli Shaman
entries: Any large group of gripplis (12 or more) will be accompanied by one or more tribal shamans. A grippli shaman has heightened Wisdom (13).

trait.name: Grippli Poison
entries: A target hit by a {@condition poisoned} grippli dart must make a successful {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for {@dice 1d4} rounds. At the end of the last turn of poisoning, the target repeats the saving throw. A successful save means the target recovers, but a failed save means the target becomes {@condition paralyzed} for {@dice 1d6} rounds. A successful saving throw does not make the target immune to later poisonings.

trait.name: Swamp Stride
entries: Gripplis can move across mud, muck, shallow water, and any other difficult terrain that arises from the presence of water without penalty.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dart
entries: {@atk r} {@hit +5} to hit, range 20 ft./60 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage. If poison is used, see grippli poison, above.

action.name: Net
entries: {@atk r} {@hit +5} to hit, range 5 ft./15 ft., one creature. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained} until it makes a successful {@dc 10} Strength check or until 5 slashing damage is done to the net (AC 10). Targets of Huge size or larger are not affected.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: A Grippli Shaman's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 11}, {@hit 3} to hit with spell attacks). It doesn't need material components to cast these spells.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: A type 1 grue can move through gaps as small as 6 square inches without penalty.

trait.name: Blends Into Darkness
entries: A grue has tactical disadvantage on Stealth checks when not in darkness or dim light.

trait.name: Extinguish Light
entries: As a bonus action, a grue can extinguish one normal (nonmagical) light within 100 feet.

trait.name: Swallow
entries: A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage automatically at the start of each of the grue's turns. Up to two Medium creatures or four Small creatures can be inside the grue at one time. A swallowed creature is unaffected by anything happening outside the grue or by attacks from outside it. A swallowed creature can get out of the grue by using 5 feet of movement, but only after the grue is dead.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d8 + 1}) piercing damage and the target must make a successful {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or be swallowed (see above).

trait.name: Aura of Darkness
entries: A type 2 grue is permanently enveloped by a sphere of darkness with a 15-foot diameter. Other than the aura's size and duration, it behaves exactly as the darkness spell.

trait.name: Extinguish Light
entries: As a bonus action, a grue can extinguish one normal (nonmagical) light within 100 feet.

trait.name: Soul Devourer
entries: The body of any creature killed by a grue, along with everything it wore or carried, fades from existence {@dice 1d6 x 10} minutes after its death unless it is protected by magic such as a gentle repose spell. Four days later, the vanished person's soul returns as a grue, and it becomes impossible for the slain creature to ever be raised.

trait.name: Spell Immunity
entries: The only spells that affect a type 2 grue are those that do radiant damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage and the grue heals half as many hit points.

trait.name: Swallow
entries: A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}. It takes 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage automatically at the start of each of the gulper's turns. Up to four Medium creatures can be inside the gulper at one time; two Small or smaller creatures count as one Medium creature. A swallowed creature is unaffected by anything happening outside the gulper or by attacks from outside it. A swallowed creature can get out of the gulper by using 5 feet of movement, but only after the gulper is dead.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage and the target must make a successful {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be swallowed (see above).

trait.name: Entangle
entries: The hanged man's noose is a 20-foot length of rope that moves on its own like an animated object to entangle opponents of any size. An entangled creature is {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained}. If it is not already adjacent to the hanged man, the rope initiates a Strength contest against the entangled creature on each of the hanged man's turns. If the rope wins the contest, it pulls the entangled creature 10 feet closer to the hanged man. If the entangled creature wins the Str contest, it stays at its current range from the hanged man. Only one creature can be entangled at a time. The rope can be attacked directly (AC 13); it is destroyed by 15 points of slashing or fire damage but is immune to all other damage. If the rope is severed, both it and the hanged man are destroyed. The rope becomes nothing more than 20 feet of rotted rope if removed from the hanged man.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A hanged man attacks once with claws and once with its rope.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Rope
entries: {@atk r} {@hit +3} to hit, range 20 ft., one creature. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) necrotic damage and the target is entangled (see above).

trait.name: Hang
entries: When a creature fails the saving throw from a constriction attack, the hangman tree hoists it off the ground by the vine around the target's neck. The creature is still {@condition grappled}, and it runs out of breath and begins suffocating.

trait.name: Paralyzed by Cold
entries: A hangman tree is {@condition paralyzed} for 1 round if it fails a Constitution saving throw after taking cold damage. The DC of the saving throw equals the spellcaster's standard DC.

trait.name: Slowed by Darkness
entries: Spells that engulf the hangman tree in darkness affect it as the slow spell for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

trait.name: Vines
entries: The vines of a hangman tree have AC 15 and 10 hit points. Only slashing damage affects them. Damage done to a vine is not subtracted from the hangman tree's overall total and does not reduce its number of vine attacks (the tree has plenty of vines to replace any that are severed).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A hangman tree attacks four times with vines and constriction in any mix, or it can release hallucinatory spores (see below).

action.name: Vine
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +8} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and the target must make a successful {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition grappled}. Because the tree seizes targets by the neck, a creature {@condition grappled} by the hangman tree can't speak or cast spells with verbal components.

action.name: Constriction
entries: {@atk m} automatic hit, one creature already {@condition grappled} by the hangman tree at the start of the tree's turn. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and the target must make a successful {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be lifted off the ground and hanged (see above).

action.name: Hallucinatory Spores
entries: {@atk a} automatic hit, range 50 ft. cloud centered on tree, creatures in range. {@h}creatures must make successful {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throws or be {@condition charmed} by the tree for {@dice 2d6} minutes. Affected creatures believe the tree to be of some ordinary sort (or to be a treant or other friendly tree creature). An affected creature won't attack the hangman tree for any reason while {@condition charmed}. A successful saving throw renders a creature immune to this tree's hallucinatory spores for 24 hours.

trait.name: Dominate Apes
entries: A hanu-naga can dance in a writhing, hypnotic way that charms apes, baboons, mandrills, and other primates with Intelligence scores of 5 or less (including humanoids). It can perform this dance even while fighting. When it dances, all primates within 60 feet are {@condition charmed} by the hanu-naga, and all other primates within one mile are drawn to the hanu-naga's location at top speed. It can have up to 20 creatures {@condition charmed} this way at one time. The hanu-naga has telepathic communication with the creatures it's {@condition charmed}, and they do their utmost to carry out its simple commands as if they are affected by a dominate beast spell. Its control lasts for as long as the hanu-naga continues dancing. Humanoids of Intelligence 5 or less who are within 60 feet of a dancing hanu-naga must make a successful {@dc 12} Charisma saving throw to avoid the hanu-naga's charm. One successful save renders a humanoid immune to this charm effect for 24 hours.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage, or half as much poison damage with a successful {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw. A creature has tactical disadvantage on this saving throw if it is {@condition grappled} by the hanu-naga.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained}.

trait.name: Air Mastery
entries: Airborne creatures have tactical disadvantage on attacks against a hawanar.

trait.name: Holocone
entries: A hawanar can transform into a vortex of embers and white-hot fire as a bonus action and can remain in this form for up to six rounds. Once it changes back to its normal form, it can't resume its holocone form for another 10 minutes. In holocone form, the hawanar genie can move through the air or along any surface at its fly speed. It can move through spaces occupied by other creatures; creatures of Medium size or smaller must make a successful {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be swept into the vortex, taking 14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage and being {@condition grappled} by the genie, which can then move the {@condition grappled} creature according to the normal grappling rules. The genie can't end its move in the same space as a character it isn't grappling.

trait.name: Mobility
entries: When a hawanar genie moves, opportunity attacks against it have tactical disadvantage

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A hawanar genie attacks twice with fists or twice with its falchion, or uses a spelllike ability.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Falchion
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage. This attack scores a critical hit if the hawanar's attack roll is a natural 18, 19, or 20.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: A hawanar genie's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, +5to hit with spell attacks). The genie doesn't need material components to use these abilities.
will: {@spell plane shift} (willing targets to elemental planes, Astral Plane, or Material Plane only)

1e: {@spell create food and water|phb|create wine and water} (as create food and water, but creates wine instead of water)

trait.name: Strangling
entries: When a hawktoad hits a target with its tongue, the monster wraps its tongue around the victim's neck. It then quickly maneuvers itself behind the target, landing on the target's back. The hawktoad digs in its claws and tries to strangle the victim with its tongue. If the targeted creature makes a successful {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, it gets an arm, a hand, or some other limb or object under the hawktoad's tongue and avoids any further danger from this specific tongue attack; the hawktoad can try again on coming turns. If the Dexterity saving throw fails, the creature is being strangled by the hawktoad; it runs out of breath and begins suffocating. As long as the hawktoad continues strangling it, the {@condition unconscious} creature can't stabilize by making successful death saving throws. If the hawktoad is killed or its stranglehold is broken, the victim can recover normally. A creature has tactical disadvantage on attacks against a hawktoad that has {@condition grappled} it and is clinging to its back. A hawktoad uses its Dex in contests to maintain its grapple, instead of Str.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A hawktoad attacks once with claws and once with its tongue.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}the target is {@condition grappled} and strangled (see above).

trait.name: Drone
entries: The rapid beating of the helix moth's wings creates an incessant droning sound that clouds the minds of creatures capable of hearing it. All such creatures within 30 feet of the moth must make a successful {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or suffer a penalty identical to being {@condition poisoned} (this is not a poison effect, however, so poison resistance and immunity don't apply). The effect lasts for 1 minute (10 rounds); at the end of that time, if the droning can still be heard, the saving throw can be repeated. A successful save renders a creature immune to the droning of helix moths for 12 hours.

trait.name: Helix Moth Poison
entries: If a player character drops to 0 hit points from a helix moth sting that caused poison damage (the character failed the saving throw), the character stabilizes automatically but remains {@condition unconscious} for {@dice 2d6} hours. The character must attempt the saving throw even if the sting's piercing damage alone was enough to drop the character to 0 hit points. Healing the character above 0 hit points won't awaken the character before the {@dice 2d6} hours have elapsed. The character can awaken early only if the poison is neutralized by lesser restoration or similar magic.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: An adult helix moth bites once and stings once.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage and the target is {@condition grappled}. If the helix moth has a target {@condition grappled} at the start of the moth's turn, it can do 11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage to that target automatically if it does not try to bite another target.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage and the target must make a successful {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage (see Helix Moth Poison above).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage.

trait.name: Swallow
entries: A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}. It takes 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage automatically at the start of each of the hieroglyphicroc's turns. Only one Medium creature or two Small creatures can be inside the hieroglyphicroc at one time. A swallowed creature is unaffected by anything happening outside the hieroglyphicroc or by attacks from outside it. A swallowed creature can get out of the hieroglyphicroc by using 5 feet of movement, but only after the hieroglyphicroc is destroyed. A humanoid that dies inside a hieroglyphicroc reanimates as a zombie {@dice 1d4} rounds later, and is regurgitated by the hieroglyphicroc.

trait.name: Unholy Fortitude
entries: Hieroglyphicrocs are highly resistant to turning. They have tactical advantage on saving throws against being turned.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) piercing damage. If the attack causes 16 or more damage to a Medium or smaller creature, the target must make a successful {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be swallowed by the hieroglyphicroc (see above).

trait.name: Lifesense
entries: En cimota lägger märke till och lokaliserar alla levande varelser inom 60 fot, utan ansträngning eller fel.

trait.name: Magic Proof
entries: En cimota lyckas automatiskt med räddningskast mot trollformler och magiska effekter om den inte väljer att inte göra det.

trait.name: Manifestation
entries: Som en handling kan en cimota transportera sig själv från vilken punkt som helst på det materiella planet till en annan punkt inom sitt definierade område eller inom 300 fot från den artefakt som den är bunden till. En cimota kan också ligga på lur på det negativa planet, beredd att manifestera sig på det materiella planet om vissa villkor är uppfyllda, till exempel om inkräktare går in i det område som cimota är dömd att vakta. En cimota kan inte attackera eller röra sig i den runda då den manifesterar sig "den är effektivt {@condition stunned} tills början av nästa tur. När den manifesterar sig, framträder den som ett skiftande moln av skuggor som sammanfogas till sin maskerade och huva form. Fram till början av nästa tur (rundan efter att den manifesteras) har dess skiftande form effekten av en suddig trollformel.

trait.name: Unholy Existence
entries: Även om det är möjligt att tillfälligt förstöra en cimotas fysiska form kommer den att återvända inom {@dice 1d6} dagar och manifestera sig igen för att fortsätta sin oheliga existens. Det enda sättet att permanent förstöra en cimota är att avbryta dess existens genom att inviga marken som den är bunden till eller genom att förstöra artefakten som den är bunden till. Ibland kan en betydande förändring av en ohelig plats, till exempel rivning av ett ondskefullt tempel eller bränning av en hemsökt skog, få cimota att försvinna permanent.

trait.name: Unnatural Aura
entries: All animals, wild or trained, become {@condition frightened} when a cimota is within 30 feet. Trained animals will approach closer if their master makes a successful {@dc 16} Wisdom (Animal Handling) check. The check allows trained animals to approach the cimota but does not eliminate the tactical disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls because of fright.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A Cimota attacks twice with Scimitars

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) lightning damage.

action.name: Dark Fury {@recharge 5}
entries: As a bonus action, a high cimota can generate a field of necrotic energy in the form of black lightning. This energy can be shaped into either a 20-foot radius sphere with the high cimota at its center, or as a 100-foot line extending from the high cimota's fingertips. Dark fury inflicts 28 ({@damage 6d8}) necrotic damage on every living creature in its area of effect; a successful {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw negates the damage. Undead, constructs and other nonliving targets are unaffected by dark fury.

trait.name: Water Dependent
entries: A hippocampus can breathe air for up to 15 minutes, but after that time, it begins suffocating.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tail Slap
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and the target is pushed 5 feet away from the hippocampus if it is Medium size or smaller.

trait.name: Winter Hunter
entries: In natural, wintry surroundings, a hoar fox has tactical advantage on both Perception and Stealth checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A hoar fox bites once or use its cold breath.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Cold Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk a} automatic hit, range 30 ft. cone, creatures in cone. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) cold damage, or half damage with a successful {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw.

trait.name: Confusion Aura (1/Day)
entries: When three huggermuggers gather in a group, they automatically generate an aura of confusion. All creatures within 40 feet of any one of the huggermuggers must make a successful {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or be affected the same as if by a confusion spell for {@dice 1d6} rounds. Each of the huggermuggers generating the effect must be no more than 30 feet from both of the other two; if one of them moves outside that range or is killed, {@condition incapacitated}, or knocked {@condition unconscious}, the aura and the effect end immediately. If another huggermugger is within range of the other two, however, it can instantly assume the fallen huggermugger's role in maintaining the confusion aura, so there is no break in the aura's effect. An individual huggermugger can contribute to creating one confusion aura per day. A creature that successfully saves against the aura is immune to all huggermugger confusion auras until the end of their next long rest.

trait.name: Cunning
entries: Huggermuggers possess cunning and logical ability far beyond what their nominal Intelligence and Wisdom scores imply. They never lose their bearings in any setting, they are never surprised, and they can automatically follow any trail that's less than 24 hours old. They have tactical advantage on Wis (Survival) checks to follow a trail that's more than 24 hours old.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sling
entries: {@atk r} {@hit +5} to hit, range 30 ft./120 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: Hyaenodons have tactical advantage on Perception checks based on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: A hyaenodon has tactical advantage on its attack roll if the target is already {@condition grappled} by at least one other hyaenodon.

trait.name: Scrapping for Food
entries: A creature that is {@condition grappled} by one or more hyaenodons takes damage automatically at the start of its turn. It takes 7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage from the first grappling hyaenodon, 11 ({@dice 2d6 + 4}) from the second hyaenodon, 14 ({@dice 3d6 + 4}) from the third hyaenodon, and so on. Up to four hyaenodons can grapple the same Small or Medium creature. Up to six can grapple a Large creature.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage and the target must make a successful {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition grappled}; see Scrapping for Food, above. A hyaenodon can't bite while it has a target {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A gohl bites three times and attacks six times with tentacles. Each tentacle can either slam or constrict.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage.

action.name: Tentacle Slam
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and the target must make a successful {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Tentacle Constriction
entries: {@atk m} automatic hit, one creature already {@condition grappled} by the gohl at the start of the gohl's turn. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Alternate Form (2/Day)
entries: Twice per day as an action, an ice drake can assume the shape of a young white dragon for 2 hours. It gains no new abilities or statistics, only the appearance.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: An ice drake bites once and attacks once with claws, or uses its breath weapon.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d6 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Ice Breathe {@recharge}
entries: {@atk a} automatic hit, range 20 ft. cone, creatures in range. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d10}) cold damage, or half damage with a successful {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: An ice drake's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 10}). The ice drake doesn't need material components to use these abilities.

trait.name: Earth Glide
entries: The igniguana can move through any sort of earth or mineral except metal as easily as a fish swims through water. This movement leaves behind no tunnel or hole, nor does it create any ripple or other sign of the igniguana's presence. It provokes an opportunity attack if it leaves a creature's reach while on the surface, but not if it does so while gliding through solid earth. The igniguana can't breathe while surrounded by solid stone or earth, so it can remain underground only for as long as it can hold its breath (15 minutes).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 4}
entries: {@atk a} automatic hit, range 20 ft. cone, creatures in cone. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage, or half damage with a successful {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw.

trait.name: Pound
entries: A jack-in-irons that grapples an opponent of Medium size or smaller can smash the opponent into the ground or any other nearby solid object as an attack. This attack hits automatically and does 15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and the creature must make a successful {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of the giant's next turn.

trait.name: Shake the Earth
entries: As an action, a jack-inirons can stomp its foot on the ground, causing powerful vibrations to radiate out around the giant. Any creature within 10 feet of the jack-in-irons must make a successful {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A jack-inirons giant makes two melee attacks in any combination of club, chain, fist, and pound, or it makes two ranged attacks, or it shakes the earth (see above).

action.name: Club
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and the target must make a successful {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of the giant's next turn.

action.name: Chain
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and the target must make a successful {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained} until the start of the giant's next turn.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and the target must make a successful {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk r} {@hit +9} to hit, range 60 ft./240 ft., one creature. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Black Fire
entries: Bright light fades to dim light, and dim light fades to darkness, within 5 feet of a jackal of darkness.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A jackal of darkness bites once and attacks once with black fire.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} för att träffa, räckvidd 1,5 meter, en varelse. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) genomträngande skada.

action.name: Black Fire
entries: {@atk m} automatic hit, reach 50 ft., one creature. {@h}the target must make a successful {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) necrotic damage immediately and again at the start of each of the jackal of darkness's turns until the jackal is destroyed, the jackal attacks a different target with black fire, the jackal is turned, or the jackal and the target are more than 50 ft. apart.

trait.name: Ambush Leap
entries: A jaculi can drop or fall as far as 30 feet without taking any damage. It takes normal damage for falling farther than 30 feet. A jaculi gets tactical advantage on an attack roll immediately after dropping 10 feet or more.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A Jupiter bloodsucker makes five melee attacks.

action.name: Vine
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Smother
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +3} to hit, one creature {@condition grappled} by the Jupiter bloodsucker. {@h}The target must make a successful {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or it begins suffocating. Suffocation continues for as long as the creature is {@condition grappled} by the Jupiter bloodsucker.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kamadan attacks once with claws, twice with snake appendages, and either bites once or uses sleep breath.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Snakes
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sleep Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk a} automatic hit, range 30 ft. cone, creatures in the cone. {@h}every creature in the cone must make a successful {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition unconscious} for {@dice 2d4} rounds.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A kampfult attacks six times with branches. Each branch can either slam or constrict.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and the target must make a successful {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Constriction
entries: {@atk m} automatic hit, one creature already {@condition grappled} by the kampfult at the start of the kampfult's turn. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained}.

trait.name: Leafy Camouflage
entries: In leafy surroundings (trees, brush), a kech has tactical advantage on Stealth checks.

trait.name: Mobility
entries: Opponents have tactical disadvantage on opportunity attacks against a kech.

trait.name: Pass Without Trace
entries: A kech moving through natural terrain leaves no detectable trail.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A kech bites once and attacks once with claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} för att träffa, räckvidd 1,5 meter, en varelse. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) genomträngande skada.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage. If the claw and bite attacks hit the same target, the second attack does an additional 3 ({@dice 1d6}) damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: A kelpie can breathe equally well in air or underwater.

trait.name: Charm (1/Day)
entries: As an action, a kelpie can force a humanoid who can see the kelpie or hear her voice to make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. If the save succeeds, the creature is immune to kelpie charm for 24 hours. If the save fails, the victim is {@condition charmed} by the kelpie for 24 hours (the saving throw is not repeated each round, as it is with the kelpie's claw attack). A {@condition charmed} creature perceives the kelpie as a beautiful and alluring creature and wants nothing more than to sit adoringly by its side, even if that means diving underwater and staying there forever. The charm is broken if the kelpie is killed or knocked {@condition unconscious}, or if dispel magic, lesser restoration, or comparable magic is used on the {@condition charmed} creature.

trait.name: Reshape Form
entries: A kelpie can assume four different physical forms. The first is simply a mass of tangled seaweed. The second is a female of any Small or Medium humanoid race, or a semihuman form in which she appears as a person from the waist up but from the hips down, she is still a tangle of seaweed. The third form is a hippocampus (see that entry). The fourth form is a Large horse. In each form, the kelpie retains all of her special abilities. Kelpies do not polymorph as true shapechangers do, they simply reshape the seaweed of their bodies. In all of her forms, a kelpie's flesh or fur has a greenish cast and her features are slightly distorted, but this distortion is usually perceived as a strikingly beautiful exoticness. A nearby observer can spot the true nature of the creature with a successful {@dc 13} Wis (Perception) check, provided they're suspicious in the first place and are not {@condition charmed}.

trait.name: Telepathy
entries: A kelpie can communicate telepathically to a range of 1 mile with any creature she's touched who is not immune to her charm.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage and a humanoid target must make a successful {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the kelpie. The effect is the same as the kelpie's charm ability (see above), but a humanoid {@condition charmed} by this attack can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns; the charm is broken by a successful save. Charming from the claw attack is unlimited.

trait.name: Earth Glide
entries: A khargra can glide through stone, dirt, and almost any other sort of earth, including metal, as easily as a fish swims through water. Its burrowing leaves behind no tunnel or hole and does not create a ripple or other sign of its presence. A move earth spell cast on an area containing a burrowing khargra flings the khargra back 30 feet and stuns the creature for 1 round unless it makes a successful Constitution saving throw.

trait.name: Metal Attunement
entries: A khargra has tactical advantage on attack rolls against targets wearing metal armor (chain shirt or better) or carrying a metal shield.

trait.name: Vulnerable to Heat
entries: A khargra takes maximum damage from a heat metal spell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A khargra attacks once with claws and bites once.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled}. If the target is using a shield, it is not {@condition grappled} but it must make a successful {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or the khargra pulls the shield away and drops it.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage if the target is {@condition grappled} by the khargra.

trait.name: Animated Hair
entries: A korred carries cuttings of its own hair, braided into ropes, in its leather pouch. It can quickly splice these short hair ropes into a longer rope and magically animate it to entangle foes. The time it takes to weave together enough rope for the job depends on the size of the creature to be entangled, as shown below. A korred's animated hair rope has AC 14, 8 hp, is immune to all but slashing damage, and flies with a speed of 30 feet. When it attacks its target, the target creature must make a successful {@dc 12} Dexterity or Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained}. A {@condition restrained} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. The hair rope is destroyed by a successful Str saving throw, but a successful Dex save leaves it unaffected and it continues attacking.

trait.name: Mobility
entries: An opponent has tactical disadvantage on opportunity attack rolls against a korred.

trait.name: Stone Stride
entries: A korred can step into a stone and emerge from any other stone within 30 feet as part of normal movement. The stones must be at least as large as the korred. It can't end its turn inside a stone.

action.name: Club
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shears
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage. A korred scores a critical hit with shears if its attack roll is a natural 18, 19, or 20.

action.name: Stone
entries: {@atk r} {@hit +4} to hit, range 20 ft./60 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Laugh {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk a} automatic hit, range 60 ft., all creatures in range. {@h}creatures in range that can hear the laugh must make a successful {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition stunned} for {@dice 1d3} rounds.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Korred's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}). A korred doesn't need material components to use these abilities.
will: {@spell speak with plants|phb|speak with stone} (functions identically to speak with plants, but with stones instead)

immune.note: damage from nonmagical or nonsilver weapons

trait.name: Ghost Flames
entries: Every creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of a kurok-spirit must make a successful {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or take 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage. The creature's maximum number of hit points is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage, and the kurok-spirit gains the same number of temporary hit points.

trait.name: Incorporeal
entries: A kurok-spirit can move through solid objects and other creatures as if they were difficult terrain. The kurok-spirit takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it is still inside something solid at the end of its turn.

trait.name: Soul Eater
entries: A creature slain by a kurok-spirit can't be raised from the dead; its soul was devoured by the kurok-spirit and no longer exists.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage and the target must make a successful {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or take 6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) psychic damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage and the lamprey enters the target's space and attaches itself to the target. While attached, the lamprey doesn't attack but automatically inflicts 4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage at the start of its turn. The lamprey can't move on its own while attached, but it moves with the other creature. To get free from the lamprey, the target creature uses its action to make a Strength (Athletics) check contested by the lamprey's Dexterity check. The lamprey has tactical advantage on this check. It can't use its bite attack again until it is pulled free or it releases the target, either of which automatically moves it out of that creature's space. A lamprey detaches immediately if it caused 5 or 6 damage that turn.

trait.name: Elemental Vulnerability
entries: Lava children take 1 extra damage per damage die from spells of the tempest domain. They are unaffected (either directly or indirectly) by spells of the transmutation school.

trait.name: Metal Immunity
entries: Lava children are completely unaffected by metal. They can walk through metal doors or bars as if the metal wasn't there, and metal objects and weapons, including magic weapons, pass right through a lava child's body without affecting it in any way. Because of this, a lava child also has tactical advantage on melee attack rolls against targets wearing armor that is predominantly metal.

trait.name: Lava Child Shaman
entries: Every band of lava children includes one arcane spellcaster.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A lava child bites once and attacks once with claws.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage. If the lava child bites the same creature that it hit with its claws this turn, its bite does an additional 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage.

trait.name: Elemental Vulnerability
entries: Lava children take 1 extra damage per damage die from spells of the tempest domain. They are unaffected (either directly or indirectly) by spells of the transmutation school.

trait.name: Metal Immunity
entries: Lava children are completely unaffected by metal. They can walk through metal doors or bars as if the metal wasn't there, and metal objects and weapons, including magic weapons, pass right through a lava child's body without affecting it in any way. Because of this, a lava child also has tactical advantage on melee attack rolls against targets wearing armor that is predominantly metal.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A lava child bites once and attacks once with claws.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage. If the lava child bites the same creature that it hit with its claws this turn, its bite does an additional 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: A lava child shaman's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 11}, {@hit 3} to hit with spell attacks). It doesn't need material components to cast these spells.

resist.note: and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Control Elemental
entries: Lava weirds have the ability to dominate elementals of the earth or fire type. When the lava weird uses an action to issue a command to an elemental within 50 feet, the elemental must make a successful {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be dominated. The effect is permanent, but the elemental is allowed to repeat the saving throw if it is commanded to do something that will clearly result in its own destruction. An elemental that makes a successful save is not dominated and is immune to this effect for 24 hours. Theres no limit to the number of elementals a lava weird can control. Once domination is established, it has no range limitation, provided the lava weird and the elemental remain on the same plane of existence. Lava weirds are immune to this effect.

trait.name: Lava Pool
entries: A creature thats dragged into a lava pool (or that falls in, or winds up in lava for any reason at all) is {@condition restrained} and takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. To escape from the lava, the creature or an adjacent ally must use an action and make a successful {@dc 15} Strength (Athletics) check. If the check succeeds, the creature moves 5 feet out of the lava pool, is {@condition prone}, and is on fire. While on fire, the creature takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. The fire is extinguished automatically when the creature or an adjacent ally spends an action to put it out.

trait.name: Reform
entries: When reduced to 0 hit points, a lava weird dissolves into its lava pool. One minute later, it reforms with full hit points minus any hit points it lost to cold damage in the preceding 24 hours.

trait.name: Camouflage
entries: Until it attacks, a lava weird in its lava pool is treated as {@condition invisible}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit (reach 5 ft.; one creature). {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) fire damage and the target must make a successful {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition grappled}. A {@condition grappled} creature takes 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) fire damage at the start of its turn. If the save succeeds, the target is not {@condition grappled} but it does catch fire if it is wearing or carrying combustible material or is itself flammable. While the fire burns, the creature takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. The fire is extinguished automatically when the creature or an adjacent ally spends an action to put it out.

action.name: Drag Into Lava
entries: {@atk m} automatic hit, one creature {@condition grappled} by the lava weird. {@h}the lava weird and the {@condition grappled} creature engage in a Strength (Athletics) contest. If the lava weird wins, the {@condition grappled} creature is dragged into the lava pool; see Lava Pool above.

trait.name: Leng Venom
entries: A Leng spider's venom causes flesh to blister and rot, reducing the target's Charisma score by 1 point. It also triggers vivid and horrific hallucinations. A {@condition poisoned} creature suffers the effect of the {@condition poisoned} condition and must act as if affected by the confusion spell. The confusion effect ends the second time the creature rolls a 9 or 10 at the start of its turn (allowing it to act normally that turn). The {@condition poisoned} condition persists until after the creature's next long rest, or until the poison is neutralized magically. Lost Charisma can be regained through magic.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A Leng-spider bites once and attacks once with web flails.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) piercing damage and the target must make a successful {@dc 11} Con saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} by Leng venom (see above).

action.name: Web Flails
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: A Leng-spider's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The Leng-spider doesn't need material components to use these abilities. It can cast dispel magic as a bonus action.

trait.name: Aversion to Daylight
entries: Boneneedles shun light. While exposed to natural (not magical) sunlight, they have tactical disadvantage on all attack rolls, saving throws, and skill checks.

trait.name: Boneneedle Poison
entries: The bite of a boneneedle injects a syrupy neurotoxin that destroys flesh and weakens bone. A creature that fails its saving throw against boneneedle poison gains the {@condition poisoned} condition. While the creature is {@condition poisoned} by boneneedle poison, it also takes an extra 2 points of damage whenever it takes bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage. Cumulative bites do not increase the extra damage. The {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw after a long or short rest, ending the {@condition poisoned} condition with a successful save. A lesser restoration spell or comparable magic also neutralizes the poison.

trait.name: Crowd
entries: Up to three boneneedles can occupy the same 5-foot space.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}({@dice 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage and the target must make a successful {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} suffering the effect of boneneedle poison (see above).

trait.name: Burning Grip
entries: The body of a lesser fire crab generates intense heat. Any creature that starts its turn with one or more lesser fire crabs latched onto it takes 2 fire damage for each of those lesser fire crabs. Once a lesser fire crab has latched onto a character, it moves with that character when the character moves, as if the character was moving a {@condition grappled} character (half-speed). A lesser fire crab releases its grip when killed or when the character wins a Strength contest against it. Up to four lesser fire crabs can latch onto a Small character, and up to eight can latch onto a Medium character.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A lesser fire crab makes two pincer attacks. Both must be against the same target.

action.name: Pincer
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) fire damage and the lesser fire crab latches onto the target with its burning grip (see above).

resist.note: and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Shadow Affinity
entries: A lesser shadow has tactical advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks in dim light or darkness, and it can make a Stealth check to become hidden as a bonus action anytime it is in darkness or dim light.

action.name: Strength Damage
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) necrotic damage and the targets Strength is reduced by 1. If its Strength is reduced to 0, the target dies. Lost Strength is recovered fully after a long or short rest.

trait.name: Electric Healing
entries: A lightning treant is immune to lightning damage, but for every 3 points of lightning damage an attack should cause, the lightning treant heals 1 hit point. Excess healing is gained as temporary hit points.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: A lightning treant regains 5 hit points at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A lightning treant attacks twice with limbs.

action.name: Limb
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature,. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) lightning damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The lightning treant's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The lightning treant doesnt need material components to use these abilities.

resist.note: and slashing damage from nonmagical or nonadamantine weapons

trait.name: Lethargy
